keep on.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to continue doing something, or to do something many times
keep on.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: You just have to keep on trying.
keep on.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to continue to employ someone, especially for longer than you had planned
keep on.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: If you’re good, they might keep you on after Christmas.
keep on.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to talk continuously about something or repeat something many times, in a way that is annoying
keep on.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: There’s no need to keep on and on about it!
If I didn’t keep on at the children, they’d never do their homework.
